revised_title: Microscopical Observations on the Suspension of the Muscular Motions of the Vibrio Tritici
tldr: The author, Francis Bauer, examines the Vibrio tritici, a small worm responsible for the destructive disease called Ear Cockle or Purples in wheat. He observes the worm's life cycle, reproduction, and survival under various conditions. Bauer also compares his findings with previous descriptions and opinions on the origin of these worms.
